cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles SW of Ft. Myers FL and 230 miles SSW of Tampa FL
cyclone.trajectory: Eta is moving north-northeast, expected to skirt the southwest Florida coast, make landfall on the west-central Florida peninsula Thursday, then cross Florida and accelerate northeastward into the western Atlantic, passing south of the Carolinas toward the weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida near the Tampa Bay / Big Bend coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anna Maria Island to Yankeetown FL; Tropical Storm Watch: Cuban provinces listed and Suwannee River to Aucilla River FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Dry Tortugas and Bonita Beach to Suwannee River FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwest and west-central Florida today–Thursday, then southeast U.S. coast (GA/SC) late week; Virginia coast largely outside impact zone
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts to near gale force (25–35 kt) possible late Saturday as the weakening remnant low passes south of Virginia.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Virginia coast from Eta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible over Tidewater area this weekend as moisture shears northward.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Enhanced surf and rip currents along the Virginia Capes once Eta’s remnants move offshore.
